title: How long psychologically would it take someone to forgive an 11-year-old? - Quora

response.answer_text: If it’s an adult and the 11 year old did standard 11 year old stuff, it should happen rather quickly. Has the 11 year old expressed sincere remorse for any wrong doing if needed? If it’s another 11 year old doing the forgiving, who knows. Then you’re talking about two kids. I might never happen. But, generally, adults should be above petty grudges, though they often aren’t.

A friend of mine’s daughter made a fake email of another friend (For some reason) and sent inappropriate emails to another friend. When they found out it was her, both friends and their families seemed angry. I was just curious how long it would take for their brains to realize that it was a childish mistake
